page.title: 07Farmer's Year near Dunmow
page.content: At Folly Farm the fields are ploughed in Autumn and are harrowed in Spring to break down the large lumps of soil left by the plough so the field will get a fine tilth. Seeds are sown in September to October depending on the weather. In winter when there is not much to do, Mr Tamlyn and his workers service and repair the machinery and buildings. Spraying is done from March to July and special attention is given to killing weeds and fungi. The corn is harvested from September onwards. Crop rotation is carried out every 4 years so that the crops remain healthy. No manure is added to the soil, but chemical fertilisers are: 7 bags of nitrogen are needed per acre: of sugar beet, and 3.5 bags for other crops.
